definition: it isn't worth it/not cost-effective/not profitable/too expensive
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to row/to paddle/profitable/worth (the effort)/it pays (to do sth)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute

sentences.english: Often, you’ll discover many items aren’t a deal at all.
sentences.chinese: 通常，你会发现很多商品交易一点都不划算。

sentences.english: It's not cost-efficient to save money in a bank for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 把钱存在银行太长时间是很不划算的。

sentences.english: but sometimes, if it's too expensive, I don't think it's justified to buy organic.
sentences.chinese: 不过有时候，如果太贵了，买有机食品就不划算了。

sentences.english: Theres no point, kill the power and run away, they are a stealthed unit.
sentences.chinese: 这很不划算，影队是隐形单位，破坏电场跑开就是了。

sentences.english: They are not cost-effective if applied to all patients.
sentences.chinese: 如果应用到所有病人他们是不划算的。

definition: to calculate/to weigh (pros and cons)/to view as profitable/worthwhile/value for money/cost-effective
worthwhile/to be a good deal/to be a bargain/to reckon up/to calculate
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
cheap/inexpensive/small advantages/to let sb off lightly
see 犯不著|犯不着[fan4 bu5 zhao2]
